column1: Goldilocks Gardner (born ) was a Hobbits of the Shire.
Goldilocks was the third daughter of Samwise Gamgee and Rose Cotton
column2: so named because her fair hair was rare among the Shire-hobbits
column3: but not among Sams children. In  she married Thain Faramir Took I

column1: Although the name refers to her hair
column2: it is also in accordance to the Hobbit custom of giving flower-names to women. Goldilocks sometimes refers to buttercup or daisy flowers.
column3: p. 613 An abandoned Sindarin name for her was Glorfinniel.
